pullsbody:
Fixes #96


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_
pull_repo_desc: Stand-alone verison of Add-on Recommendation for Shield Study
pull_commit_message:
Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #96.

_(Message COC002)_

pulltitle: Refactoring of onboarding code (better fix for #91)
pullsbody:
There are several methods that rely on the simple pref that marks the onboarding as complete. #91 alters the way the simple pref is used, which causes several issues. This commit fixes the issue that #91 fixes, but in a way which does not break the methods that depend specific usage of the onboarding pref.

The key change is that the tabs event listener that calls the endOnboard method is now the onOpen listener, rather than the onReady. onOpen fires immediately when the tab opens, while onReady fires once the page is completely loaded. Use of onReady contributed to the repeated onboarding events some users expirienced, as closing the tab before it loads completely would mean the onboarding complete pref was never set to true.

Testing using the same procedures as #91, namely simulating a 100% loss network on my computer and installing the addon on a fresh firefox build (to test closing the onboarding tab before it fully loads), showed that this commit fixes the issue of repeated onboarding events. Additionally, the methods that rely on the onboarding pref are not broken in this commit, as the usage of the pref is returned to the way it was previously.

@mythmon r?
pull_repo_desc: Stand-alone verison of Add-on Recommendation for Shield Study
pull_commit_message:
Refactoring of onboarding code

There are several methods that rely on the simple pref that marks the onboarding as complete. #91 alters the way the simple pref is used, which causes several issues. This commit fixes the issue that #91 fixes, but in a way which does not break the methods that depend specific usage of the onboarding pref.

The key change is that the tabs event listener that calls the endOnboard method is now the onOpen listener, rather than the onReady. onOpen fires immediately when the tab opens, while onReady fires once the page is completely loaded. Use of onReady contributed to the repeated onboarding events some users expirienced, as closing the tab before it loads completely would mean the onboarding complete pref was never set to true.

Testing using the same procedures as #91, namely simulating a 100% loss network on my computer and installing the addon on a fresh firefox build (to test closing the onboarding tab before it fully loads), showed that this commit fixes the issue of repeated onboarding events. Additionally, the methods that rely on the onboarding pref are not broken in this commit, as the usage of the pref is returned to the way it was previously.

pulltitle: Resolve onboarding bug where wikipedia is opened on every startup
pullsbody:
This is a clean solution to the issue in #89.

@mythmon r?
pull_repo_desc: Stand-alone verison of Add-on Recommendation for Shield Study
pull_commit_message:
Resolve onboarding bug where wikipedia is opened on every startup

I'm using simple prefs to note that the onboarding event (where wikipedia is opened) has occurred. Previously the pref was set after the page had fully loaded, meaning that if users closed the wikipedia tab early (on a slow internet connection), the onboarding event would not be marked as complete. Therefore I've moved the pref set to as soon as the onboard method is called, eliminating this race condition.

I replicated the issue by simulating a very slow internet connection on my computer and testing the addon. This PR fixes the issue in my testing.

pulltitle: User feedback indicates that wikipedia tab is opened on every startup
pullsbody: This bug is likely in the onboarding event. In this event, a new tab of wikipedia is opened, and users are shown how to use addon recommendation. The feedback suggests that this event is happening on every startup when it should only happen when the addon is installed.

Add stylesheet for button, remove mouseover / mouseout

The styles for the enhance button were moved into a css file that is applied using the sdk style sheet service. This means that the button styles no longer need to be applied with js, and in particular, :hover can be used, so that the mouseover / mouseout listeners can be removed from the js.

pulltitle: Fix Cleanup Function so that addon can uninstall itself
pullsbody: thanks so much to @gregglind for figuring this issue out. @Osmose r?
pull_repo_desc: Stand-alone verison of Add-on Recommendation for Shield Study
pull_commit_message:
Only call Rec.destroy if Rec != null

Previously Rec.destroy was being called on every call to cleanup function. The cleanup function is used in the uninstall process. When rec.destroy was called when Rec == null (set to null on first pass of cleanup function), the cleanup function would fail and the addon would not uninstall itself. The survey would then be displayed on the next startup, the cleanup function would fail again. There is now a check to only call Rec.destroy if it is not null (where if rec == null, rec.destroy has already been called)

Closes #77

pulltitle: Keep track of panel state, don't always call "showPanel"
pullsbody: @Osmose r?
pull_repo_desc: Stand-alone verison of Add-on Recommendation for Shield Study
pull_commit_message:
Use sdk/panel onOpen event listener

When the panel is constructed, Recommend.js's handlePanelOpen is specified as the callback function for whenever the panel opens. The telemetry logging for panel open events is done here. This way, Recommend.js does not have to keep track of the state of the panel.

Closes #66

Closes #65

pullsbody:
This is something that I should have done from the beginning. I thought that the effects of this rule were already in place by default, so I was confused several times when margins did not behave in a way that I expected. I didn't think that this was why though. 

Most notably, when I brought in `_installButton.scss` originally, the install button did not look as expected because the writers had assumed that border-box was applied somewhere else. I made some adjustments to it a while ago, not knowing that I should have used border box. I've now brought the original verison of _installButton from the disco page back in.

There were several css adjustments I had to make the switch to border-box. 

@mythmon r?

pulltitle: Fix up addon icon styling and recommendation padding
pullsbody:
The icons are no longer stretched in appearance. Fixing styling of the images also fixed the overflow issue with the "why am I seeing this?" panel. I also fixed up issues with the padding of the items in the panel, so that they are more centered.

@Osmose r?
pull_repo_desc: Stand-alone verison of Add-on Recommendation for Shield Study
pull_commit_message: fixed padding of welcome message

pullsbody: r?
